utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Kimberly Guilfoyle along with Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino and Tom Shillue. It's 5 o'clock in New York City and this is "The Five." Fox News has obtained more text messages from those anti-Trump lovers at the FBI, agents who were investigating his campaigns possible ties to Russia. On Election Day, Lisa Page writes, oh, my God. This is terrifying. Peter Strzok replies, oh, my God. I am so depressed. Later that month, Page wrote, I've got all the president's men. Figure I need to brush up on Watergate. The texts are raising even more questions about what the FBI and former President Obama knew about the Clinton investigation and when. And when newly obtain message, Page writes about preparing talking points for FBI director James Comey, saying, POTUS wants to know everything we're doing. Didn't Mr. Obama once insist he never got involved in FBI investigations?

utterances.speaker: THEN-PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA
utterances.utterance: I do not talk to the attorney general about pending investigations. I do not talk to FBI directors about pending investigations. We have a strict line and always have maintained it as president.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS WALLACE, 'FOX NEWS SUNDAY' ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Just to buttoned this up.

utterances.speaker: OBAMA
utterances.utterance: I guarantee it. I guarantee that there is no political influence in any investigation conducted by the justice department or the FBI. Not just in this case but any case. Full stop, period.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Full stop, Dana, period.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Again, it could look terrible or it could be that he has seeking a briefing about the Russian involvement and meddling in the election. From these text messages, we don't know that. You could also be briefed and not try to weigh in if you're concerned about Russian involvement because remember the DNC was saying we were hacked. The Russians did this. And I'm sure that he wanted to say something. One of the criticisms of President Obama from Democrats is that he did not do enough talking about Russian meddling in the election. And if this were really about the Mueller probe, well, that would be one thing to know. We don't know that. And if it's about Hillary's email scandal and if President Obama wanted to squash it, he wasn't very effective because ten days before the election is when James Comey sends a letter back up to congress that says, by the way, I'm reopening the Hillary email investigation case. If you remember, Hillary Clinton in her book, and not just in her book but in all of her interviews, blames James Comey for her loss to President Trump. So I'm not exactly sure what's going on here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Jesse, do you have any clarity in your mind?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I wish I did. I'd like to know more. They should be testifying up on Capitol Hill. This maybe the first clue though we have of President Obama possibly being involved in the FBI shenanigans. If he wants to know what the FBI is up to. Is it about the Hillary investigation? That was closed at the time this text was sent. Is it about the Trump-Russia investigation?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not at that point. That was the 28th, this was the 2nd of September. It wasn't about the Trump-Russia investigation? We don't know that either. If it was about the DNC hack, he wants to know about that, they never even got the DNC server from the Democrats. They never handed it over. So that's suspicious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Never answered the calls.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Never even answered the calls. Obama says, you know, he doesn't comment on pending investigations. He commented on the Hillary investigation on camera. He said that it never jeopardized national security. Actually, Comey then contradicted himself and said it did jeopardize national security. He waited on the IRS probe when that was pending. So just a few hooligans in the Cincinnati office. You know what, it was more than that because Lois Lerner took the fifth. You had also text messages saying we have to focus on the task at hand. What are these anti-Trump FBI agents talking about? What's the task at hand? If they're so terrified about the election of President Trump, does it have anything to do with the insurance policy that they hatched in the department of justice's office? I like to know about that. That's why they should testify. They're also talking about a phone they have where they're talking about Hillary Clinton's investigation and we can't talk on this phone. Where that phone go? I'd like to see that phone. Maybe they smashed it with a hammer, like Hillary. They're Trump haters and they're snobs because they referred to Republican voters in Virginia as ignorant hillbillies. And they're also Comey's loyalists and they love him to death. We've seen those texts. And they hate congressional oversight. They were besmirching the Republican congress. There's also a wide gap too which was very interesting. So, on the 28th of September, 2016, they discovered these Huma and Hillary emails on Weiner's laptop. A whole month passed before Comey comes out and he says he was just briefed on the new emails they discovered. What happened in that month? I'd like to know that. People suspect McCabe who was ushered out by Christopher Wray, may have had something to do with delaying that. We're going to find out sooner or later. But the bottom line is that it's clear now that these Trump-hating FBI agents were on an anti-Trump mission and President Obama may be involved.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: That's really funny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The joke is on you, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, I think at some point, Jesse, it's like, you know, they talk about fog of war. This is fog of foolishness.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, tell me why.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because it's obvious the president, and Dana picked up on this, Democrats are upset that President Obama did not do enough in terms of the Russian interference, that he and the intelligence agencies had confirmed was taking place during the 2016 election.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The idea that the FBI should be briefing the president on Russian interference is not far-fetched. That makes sense.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How do you know that's what President Obama wanted to be briefed on?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because the circumstances, the timing is exactly right. Not only that, the Wall Street Journal has an article out today and it says text from the 2016 preparations to brief Barack Obama about Russian interference in that year's election. So Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, I don't interrupt you. I let you rave and rave on this show. I let you have the floor. But Jesse, at some point, don't you think it would be good, instead of always throwing up conspiracy theories to try to defend the indefensible, Donald Trump, you might come with some facts?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You've been calling this whole thing a conspiracy for the last year. Yet, every time facts comes out it proves you wrong.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Give me some facts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Everything I said about Hillary's probe was rinse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. Please, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: . on this topic don't bring Obama into it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't bring him into it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You always.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's in the text.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Juan, we have text messages part of the element for tonight's show.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm saying everybody knows what this is about, except Jesse, who wants to make it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This could have been about Clinton, the Russia probe or the Trump surveillance.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Even today, Eric Holder at a breakfast meeting said President Obama never contacted him about any FBI investigations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't trust Eric Holder as far as I can throw him.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, GUEST CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Didn't we just play a clip of President Obama saying he doesn't get involved in FBI investigations? Whether it's about Donald Trump or the Russian investigation, he's involved, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's asking -- tell me what's going on with the Russians trying to influence an American election.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're putting words in the text.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I see. OK. The Wall Street Journal is too, I guess.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: The thing is with every bombshell -- it's like we're getting shell-shocked because no one is a bombshell. Every time new information comes out, more texts came out, we forget about the last one. I always think that the best references in these Strzok-Page texts have to do with Hillary. You know on September 28th, you were talking about, you know, the Andy's office meeting. He said, you know, new emails came out to Huma and Weiner's emails came out. And he says -- Strzok says, will this never end? Strzok. Will this never end? He's dying to wrap up this Hillary thing. And you go back five months before when he says -- when Trump was going to be the nominee, remember when Cruz dropped out and Trump was going to be the nominee, they were going crazy on the text. I can't believe it. Oh, my gosh. Trump is going to be the nominee. And now the pressure starts to finish the MYE. We know what that is, the Hillary investigation. He was trying to wrap up that Hillary investigation. And Juan, that's your evidence. It's all over the place. Bring in the jury. I will stand and I'm ready to lecture to the jury. There's so many incriminating texts in this Strzok thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know he was right about one thing?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: What's that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It will never end. We're still talking about it at 2018. One thing it does go back to over and over again is the decision by Hillary Clinton and her team that allowed her to do it, including the White House that allowed her to have a private server, a separate set of circumstances, emails that got destroyed, wiped from the server. These guys end up talking about -- having their affair and talking about this is an investigation on their government phones.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Did they talk about anything?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know? A lot of it was redacted, right? I don't know. Did you read the whole thing?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We didn't get the good stuff.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: At one point he says is it OK for me to send you some pictures. That's what he said.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Coming up on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We don't have pictures.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We like pictures.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, we don't. Pretty sure we don't.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But Tom, just because we have two lovers who are sending -- I mean it's unbelievable how many emails they sent, right? Fifty thousand. It doesn't mean that you can't have personal opinions.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It does. Juan, it's more than that. People keep saying that. It's just people with a bias. They can put it aside. They can't put it aside. He's going to be president. I'm losing my mind, exclamation point. It's unbelievable. We've got to do something. I mean, it's very incriminating.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Election Day 2016, there're people in this building screaming, really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: To the point, like, if they were trying to stop something, they were very ineffective because, again, Comey's letter ten days before the election is what so many Democrats point to as the point where they saw a lot of independent women support drop in all of the key states.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It should have drop more.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: But our guy, Strzok, right? Strzok changed the words. He changed it -- what's the word, Jesse? From extremely negligent to.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: So it would have dropped even more if he didn't watered it down.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're talking about when Comey was speaking in July, not in September, early October.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to tell you guys about this other memo that drop last night, this Grassley memo. Now, this is really interesting, Juan. I'd like to hear your defense on this. So, Hillary's crony, Sid Blumenthal, he was feeding anti-Trump smears through the Obama state department and it end up in Chris Steele's dossier. Now, Christopher Steele dossier was based on what we know on two things, Russian government sources and Sid Blumenthal's lies. The FBI also knew that Christopher Steele had been lying and have been leaking to the press about this. Yet they still used the dossier, and they still used Steele's credibility to the FISA court to present that as justification for spying on the Trump associates. Why would the FBI do that? Why would they hide the funding from the judge? Why did they deceive the judge?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We've got Trey Gowdy on this and I will ask you to give your reaction, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: REP. TREY GOWDY, R-S.C.
utterances.utterance: When you hear who the source -- one of the sources of that information is you're going to think, oh, my gosh. I've heard that name somewhere before. Where could it possibly have been?

utterances.speaker: MARTHA MACCALLUM, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: The foreign source? GOWDY The domestic source. And I'm trying to think how Secretary Clinton defined him? I think she said he was an old friend who emailed her from time to time.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Sidney Blumenthal?

utterances.speaker: GOWDY
utterances.utterance: That would be really warm, really warm. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That be hot.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Juan, we'll get your respond to that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, I don't get it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We know, Juan. You don't get it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't get why you think that this is somehow an indictment of the Steele dossier or the investigation. I would hope that you would have every source available if you are trying to get information about how the Russians are trying to influence our election and potentially colluding with candidate Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The source of the dossier was a Hillary crony and Russian liars in the Russian government. Do you think that's enough to present to a judge to spy on Americans? It's not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're not allowed to do that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You cannot present unverified information to a FISA judge.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, slow down, man. Let me talk for a second. You might learn something, OK. But clearly, the judge was told that the source of the dossier was a political partisan. The judge understood this. Political.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No bearing whether or not the opponent of the person they're running for president against.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It wasn't true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Of course it was true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What was true about the dossier?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm not getting into that here, but.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All that we know about today -- this day with this business about the FBI lovers and their texts, you guys are so desperate to somehow undermine Robert Mueller. You'll do anything. Republicans will put on blinders.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Nevertheless, you're not been able to proffer one fact forward that was accurate or true in the dossier to support that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Are you kidding?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: How about the Russians interfered in our presidential election.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, that's one thing that Trey Gowdy also said to Martha last night. In the interview he said regardless of the dossier, there would have been an investigation about Russian meddling in the election. But the other thing I want to say about the Grassley memo that you mentioned that kind of irritates me about the Nunes memo. But apparently -- remember, I made this whole big thing about how you shouldn't take a Yahoo News article in to convince the judge that there's corroboration. Well, in the Grassley memo, it says it wasn't used for corroboration that Yahoo News article. So I feel like -- you know, I get cautious about commenting on all of this because it's cherry picked information. It's not complete.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't get what you mean.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The Grassley memo says that the Yahoo News article was used to (INAUDIBLE). But that is not why the articles was referenced. The Grassley memo appears to confirm that it was not presented for the purpose of corroboration.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, there's a contradiction.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't read that in the memo. I didn't see that. I know they did present it alongside the dossier.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I'll be calm, Juan. I'll be calm. I'll be friendly. It's dirty.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's dirty.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It's dirty.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what I think, Peter Strzok is going to start sending texts to Jesse, little love notes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Please don't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'll bleach him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, we've got to go. You guys can continue this witty repartee during the break or not. We have the greatest military in the world and our commander-in-chief wants to show it off. But President Trump is getting pushback on his idea to hold a parade for our troops. That's next on The Five. Won't you stay with us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We have the most powerful military the world and President Trump wants to honor our service members with a parade. He got the idea from watching Bastille Day celebrations on a trip to France in the summer. The Pentagon is looking at options.

utterances.speaker: DEFENSE SECRETARY MATTIS
utterances.utterance: I think we're all aware in this country of the president's affection and respect for the military. We've been putting together some options. We'll send them up to the White House for a decision. The president respect his fondness for the military, I think it's reflected in him asking for these options.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Of course, the parade of critics are crowing about the idea.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This is beneath us as a nation. We are the most powerful military on earth. We're very proud of that, rightly so. We don't need to be parading our military hardware down Pennsylvania Avenue to show that to anybody.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's a fantastic waste of money to amuse the president.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We have a Napoleon in the making here. I think everyone should be offended by his need to always be showy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, I was reading twitter last night, and Ari Fleischer, one of your guys, press secretary, said when he was, I think, 30, they had the '91 Desert Storm parade in America and it was a spectacle that he really enjoyed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah, and he said he wouldn't mind doing it again. It was after that big military victory, it cost $12 million at the time. Apparently, this would cost upwards of $22 million. Jennifer Griffin was on the show today, the 2 PM show, and I asked her what's the reaction at the Pentagon? And she said it was a collective eye roll.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, gosh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do think that the Democrats though were very predictable in their response. And I don't think it was politically smart to do so. I think that what you should have said if you're a Democrat is to say we honor the troops all the time. We love the military. In fact, what we should do, Mr. President, the money that you want to spend on the parade, let's put that it into increasing wages for the men and women in uniform. I think that would be a better way to do it, Mr. President. And then, they wouldn't look like they are just being petty and thinking that he's trying to turn us into a dictatorship. But the other thing is, as soon as I heard about this news, I knew it would be another one of these draw line in the culture wars sand, and if you are not for this then you hate the military. You don't like the president. And if you are for it, then you are turning the country into a dictatorship. I think that we do a lot of honoring of the troops. If they decide to have a parade, and we decide as a country that it's worth the money to do it, great. But we shouldn't be blind to the fact that there's a ton of politics here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There are a ton of politics. And Dana makes the point that Democrats could get boxed in on the issue, Juan, just like they did with the national anthem and the NFL and the kneeling where President Trump comes out strong with the side of the Patriots.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the patriotic people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And 30 percent of the Democrats and the far left look like they're anti-flag. Do you worry about that happening again?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it's inevitable to some degree because we have such a polarized group of Americans these days. So the president -- people who are Trump supporters will say, well, he wants a big parade. He's honoring the military. It's all about patriotism. You stop and say, well, how many patriotic presidents have we had and nobody does this. Where do we see this kind of thing? We see it in Red square. We see it from the North Korean.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He saw it in France.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. I thought you guys love French people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me tell you, the French have a tradition. Bastille Day goes back of waves because of the French revolution.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And when George H.W. Bush did this, we had just won something. There was something to celebrate. On the contrary, we're still stuck in Afghanistan at the moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think may be one idea, Kimberly, is to do it on the 100 year anniversary of America's victory in World War I, which would be November, and that way it might be less political. And I would like to nominate you to be the grand marshal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would love this. Indeed, I would. I love a good parade. I do. I mean, a nice lawful parade where people are respectful and they clean up the streets after.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think it would be fantastic to have something like this. I would really enjoy it. I think the president is genuine and sincere in his appreciation, his love for the military. They do so much. So we want to begrudge them a parade, why? Why not? Why wouldn't any patriotic American say let's have a nice parade. I get it about expenses and this and that. But we seem to spend a lot of money recklessly and foolishly on things that don't matter. And I think our liberty and our personal freedom and freedom of expression, the people gleefully enjoying this country that been hard- fought and won by the brave men and women in our military. So, I'm all for honoring them in any way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Would you wear a helmet? Would you wear a helmet if you're in a tank and you're rolling down Constitutional Avenue?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's not Dukakis.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I wanted to be Mike Dukakis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you pro-parade or anti-parade?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I could use that as a voting brochure. If you're pro-parade, I'm going to vote for you. Parades are fantastic. And it's amazing how quickly we jump from parade to North Korea. I mean, it's quite amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You saw that? I was waiting for it like, one, two.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like what you would have said if President Obama came up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm curious.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tremendous waste of money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The parade should definitely just have a bunch of guys with their laptops because our best weapon right now is cyber. Cyber warfare is the most important weapon that we have.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A cyber parade.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, they can have their own float.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Joe Biden out and about letting it rips again on President Trump. Your afternoon cup with Joe, up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Former vice president, Joe Biden, hasn't kept his feelings about the president close to the vest, and he's not about to start now. Joe was fired up about Mr. Trump's attacks on the FBI, Democrats and more in a brand-new interview. Here are some highlights.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: This is the first president to make a full-throated, unvarnished attack on the entirety of the FBI, sowing doubt about whether or not our justice system is fair, sowing doubt about whether or not there is anything that's remotely consistent with our Constitution. It's just -- it's just -- it's a disaster. I just marvel at some of the things he says and does, like what, two days ago. Anybody who didn't stand up and clap for him was un-American and then maybe even treasonous. Well, let me tell you, he's a joke.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow. Kimberly, how would you respond? Because I know you like Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, yes, that he really took it down a few notches for me there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't like it. I mean, look, I liked him in terms of his personality, whatever. I don't like his rhetoric and his comments about the president there. I think that -- I don't know. It just seemed kind of, like, not in keeping with the Joe Biden we kind of know. I thought it was a little harsh, aggressive, and also inaccurate. I don't know that he served well for his future political aspirations by saying something like that, per se. Maybe, maybe. But there's people, I think if you're Joe Biden, that you think you can get that are crossovers or independents. And I don't know. By saying something like that about the president, I don't know that it was a smart strategic political move. That's what I was thinking about.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So Dana, when you watch it, I know you always look at things from a messaging point of view. One of the things that the former vice president had to say was that President Trump's always trying to undo everything that President Obama did. And he says, on trying to undo the legacy so far, he's failed. Does that message...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think -- one, I think the proof does not bear that out. I think the dereg piece of the Trump administration has been quite impressive, and that has been because, remember, President Obama got so frustrated, didn't want to compromise. So he decided he'd use his pen and a phone. And then that means that the next president can use a pen and a phone, as well, to undue that part of your legacy. And also on the judges front for President Trump, that's significant. I think that Biden, he personifies the Democrats' problem right now. On the one hand, he can really appeal to some Democrats, in -- like in the northeast, maybe, and the west. But there might not even be room for him in the Democratic Party if it continues to move so far left. And the other thing is he will be 80 years old or so around the time that, if he were going to be running, or in his upper 70s. And maybe the upper 70s might be the new 50. But if you have all of these younger people in a very crowded Democratic primary, I think that will be really difficult. And I'm going to disagree with Kimberly on one thing. I think that Joe Biden has been a very effective attack dog for the Democrats for a long time. And President Obama could rise above and let him go out, and he's not afraid to mix it up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, I agree with that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that he thinks that -- I think that Biden thinks he's counterpunching. And the Democrats are going to want somebody who is that aggressive.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jess?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, listen, if Trump is the joke, then Biden is the punch line. The name "Biden" is synonymous with gaffes, whether it's telling somebody in a wheelchair to stand up, dropping the f-bomb on a hot mic, or getting handsy with young ladies in a photo line. He hasn't distinguished himself as V.P. If Dick Cheney had called Biden a joke or Obama a joke, I mean, there would have been hell to pay. So I didn't think it was in keeping with presidential or vice presidential protocol.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what I thought.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the elder statesmen of the Democratic Party have really been in the gutter recently. President Obama kind of hinted that Donald Trump was like Hitler. John Kerry was interfering in Trump's Middle East peace process. Hillary has accused President Trump of being a Russian traitor. And then V.P. Biden comes out and calls him a joke. I think they're a little desperate, Juan. He might be testing the waters. But they might need a heavy hitter to come out and throw some punches after the bad news the Democrats have endured the last couple weeks. But if you really want to get into a schoolyard contest with President Trump, I don't think Biden is going to win that battle.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He'll have a nickname before long.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think he said he wanted to take Trump out in the schoolyard at one point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So Tom, here's the most surprising thing from the interview. He says that if it was one of Trump's lawyers, he'd advise the president not to meet and be interviewed by Robert Mueller.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: That was the least surprising thing in the interview, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Really? OK.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Of course. I think everybody would give him that advice.

utterances.speaker: I think the most surprising thing was this
utterances.utterance: "A full-throated, unvarnished attack on the entirety of the FBI." What is he talking about? What is he talking about? It is not a full-throated attack on the entire FBI. Everybody, the right-wingest among us is forced now to, when we're talking about this thing, to say this isn't about the rank and file of the FBI. It's about the five or six people that are mentioned in this memo and all these texts and everything else. We think they're the rotten ones. And that's what the president says, as well. What is this thing about the full-throated attack? That's ridiculous, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You think that's ridiculous? Really?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I think it's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because people might confuse it? I see.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Because no one has a full-throated attack on the FBI. Not even Sean "Right-Wing" Hannity. Every night, he can't finish a sentence without saying this isn't about the rank and file.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, well...

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: We all agree on that, Juan. Including the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what, Tom? You've been vindicated, to quote President Trump. Yes, that memo has vindicated you. And Hannity...

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: A hundred percent.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hannity.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... will vindicate you tonight. Vindicate? Yes, vindicate. Validate. A surprise Olympic decision by Kim Jong-un coming up next. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The 2018 Winter Olympics begin in South Korea on Friday. North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un won't be there, but he's sending his younger sister to attend as part of a government delegation. History will be made. Kim Yo-jong will be the first immediate member of her ruling family to ever set foot in the south. The news was just announced before Vice President Pence delivered a new warning to her big brother.

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE (R), VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I'm announcing today that the United States of America will soon unveil the toughest and most aggressive round of economic sanctions on North Korea ever. And we will continue to isolate North Korea until it abandons its nuclear and ballistic missile program once and for all.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So Kimberly, I like this diplomatic approach, because when North Korean said, "Well, maybe" -- told the South Koreans, "We'll come. I don't know if we can do something joint." And we were all, like, "OK, good. Maybe this is good, a nice opening." And then we follow up with a little bit of "But don't forget we're watching you, and we're going to continue to make sure you denuclearize." I like it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think it is. It was measured. It was reasonable. It seems that it's, you know -- it's been effective and so far. They should maintain this course. And I think it's interesting that he's sending a woman, sending his sister there. So he's trying to make some smart moves on, you know, his behalf to improve their international image and sending a female. All of the above, especially since they have had horrific press, deservedly so...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: ... in light of Otto Warmbier and what they did to him and the other human rights atrocities that they commit on a regular basis under this regime. So but I think the words of our vice president were very measured and good and forceful in the right tone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So Jesse, do you think all of this attempt by North Korea to look so normal is maybe going a little too far. That the South Koreans might have gone overboard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, the South Korean prime minister's approval rating is starting to nosedive as these attempts at reunification are going along. What do we call the sister? Little Rocket Woman? I think Trump needs a new nickname for her. I'd like to see a picture of her. Do we -- Is that her right there?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think so.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Ask and you shall receive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, I think it's a smart overture on Little Rocket Man's behalf to send the younger sister. It's all converging at the same time these sanctions are really starting to bite, and the president deserves credit for the tough sanctions along with the war games going on and some of the rhetoric coming out of the United States and our generals. So you know, hopefully this goes in the right direction, because I know they'd better behave themselves during the Olympics or there's going to be hell to pay.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, it is pretty remarkable that he would send his sister, and she is the first person in their family to ever step foot in South Korea since the split.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, you know, from a historic point of view, you've got to stop and think, "Wow, those people are so divided." I mean, they're neighbors. What strikes me about this is that, in terms of the sanction, her presence there is a violation of the sanctions. She is not supposed to be allowed to travel. So in a way, I think that Kim Jong-un might think he's being smart. He's thumbing his nose at a lot of people by sending her, because people are going to say, well, yes, she should be allowed in as part of the delegation. Vice President Pence saying, "Well, we'll see." I think that was the most important part of his quote. It's also, I think, being very smart to say if they want to talk, if there's a possibility, he's open to it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think that's the message we want to spend not only in terms of the North Koreans but in terms of the world, in terms of saying it's not ideal for us to have the South Korean joining forces with the North Koreans and this delegation. Because we, as Americans, want to send a clear message that North Korea's behavior is unacceptable.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Now Tom, I've got 38 seconds for you, and you know radio. So tell us, what do you think about this?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Well, is it supposed to make us feel safer that he's sending a family member? Didn't he kill his uncle?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I mean, is that supposed to...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You only needed eight seconds.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Exactly. He's, like, poisoning people in airports, and the fact that he sends his sister, I don't know if that's...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe she should be worried.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. So I don't know what the plans are.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right? I mean, you don't need to worry. Maybe she should be.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe the sister deserts and stays in South Korea. You never know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Actually, I had that thought while you were talking, like, I wonder if there's any way that she could be -- like, blink twice if you want us to come and rescue you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Top Democrat Adam Schiff pranked by Russians promising dirt on President Trump ahead.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: The ranking member of the House Intelligence Committee caught on tape talking to the Russians. Adam Schiff fooled by two Russian radio hosts promising compromising photos of President Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: She got compromising material on Trump after their short relations.

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF (D-CA), RANKING MEMBER, INTELLIGENCE COMMITTEE
utterances.utterance: OK. And what's the nature of the Kompromat?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Well, there were pictures of naked Trump.

utterances.speaker: SCHIFF
utterances.utterance: OK. And so Putin was made aware of the availability of the compromising material?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: SCHIFF
utterances.utterance: OK. Well, thank you very much. We will be back in touch with you through our staff to make arrangements to obtain these materials for our committee and for the FBI. And I appreciate your reaching out to us.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Punk'd. Juan, I say guilty. He even talks like a Russian. "Kompromat"? What's he talking about?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, the idea is the compromising material.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. It sounds like, you know...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Get it? "Kompro-mat."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: OK. The -- sounds like collusion, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, it does? Sounds to me like this is...

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Chatting with the Russians.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: How old is this story, Tom?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: It's -- this is fresh. It's fresh. It's fresh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're like the guy from the bakery. "Yes, well, it was here yesterday."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Freshened it up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fresh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The story has been here for years, but it's out now because Republicans want to bury that Schiff memo that the president has to decide on.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: You couldn't...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They're attacking Schiff all of a sudden, like, "Oh, this is new."

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Why are you promoting the memo? Aren't the Republicans saying release all the memo? Release the memo? They voted to release it. They want all the memos out, right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, so Trump hasn't approved the release of the memo. So right now, he's on a hot spot. Everybody is waiting to see what he does. And I think that's why Trump's allies now decide, "You know what? We've got to go after Adam Schiff."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So you're saying these are Trump's allies, and they set him up with -- come on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Not set him up with the phone call. The phone call was a prankster call, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, right, but you want to blame the president for that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's an old story that they brought out now because of the memo.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I hear what you're saying, but nevertheless, he took the call. He did say...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Didn't they do this with Sarah Palin? They -- when she was on the campaign trail and these radio pranksters called.

utterances.speaker: SCHIFF
utterances.utterance: Yes, they tricked a lot of this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And they said president of whatever, and she took the call. And it's just like you should have protocols, but sometimes on a campaign, you don't.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: He said that he thought all along that it was -- that it was a prank. So why did he get on the line? If he thought it was a prank, don't you think he would've given it to some of his flunkies?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, did he think it was a prank from the very beginning? Or when he starts talking to them? Because you can sort of hear it in his voice. Is like, OK, and then what?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: He was just taking notes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here's when he should've known it was a prank. The Russian woman's name was Olga Pusalot. Pusalot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I get it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, Schiff is a sucker. Come on. And why...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He would have caught that right away. He's used that line.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Pusalot, please. Why do the Democrats keep wanting to see Trump naked? What is it with you guys? First the dossier. Then you're taking -- oh, nude Trump. OH, let's call our FBI contacts. What is it with you guys? You guys are running on revenge porn.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Revenge porn.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's all you guys have, revenge porn.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OH, I think Stormy Daniels might have revenge porn.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You mean the daughter of the Kardashians, that Stormy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. Stormy Daniels. Look it up. I don't think your mom will let you see it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Never heard of her.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Really intellectual conversation.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Hey, guys, we have to go. Is that what they are telling me? You guys putting all the -- can you put the split screen before we leave of Schiff? I don't look like Adam Schiff. All right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. You do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Put it up.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: This is what everyone on Twitter does. They put my face next to Adam.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, you do. You do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You kind of do. But you know what? He's very handsome.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: He is very handsome.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm just complimenting Tom.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, you look...

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you're better looking than he is.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hi. It's time now for "One More Thing." And another amazing episode of the highly-acclaimed, yes, "Kimberly's Food Court." There we go. Not sponsored by onions or beets. Remember that. OK. So here's some amazing news that my friend Jesse Watters, who never wants me to pass up a good food court, let me know about today. McDonald's is launching a limited-edition version of the Big Mac for a limited time. That's redundant. The junior and supersized version will celebrate 50 years since it launched. Jesse's going to dig in right there. So we have the Mack Junior, which I shall have here. Sans onions.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And he has a Grand Big Mac.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And they're available from February 7 to March 20. Jesse, you think yours is good?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's so good. It's all over my face.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's a different -- that's Carl's Jr.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's so good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: When you get it all over your face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's all over the place. Amazing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It smells great.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: This is actually quite delicious and the perfect size. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. OK. So elementary school in Texas, there was a gentleman serving overseas in Qatar and was just welcomed back for a little surprise. Let's see it.

utterances.speaker: MUSIC
utterances.utterance: Proud to be an American where at least I know I'm free.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Daddy! This is my daddy!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aww. So Staff Sergeant Garrett Marin surprised his son Connor Marin, Pecan Grove Elementary School. And I just love those moments. They're great to watch. And just, you know...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fantastic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: ... beautiful.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Love them. Oh, very nice. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. So, you know, I'm a baby hugger. You all know that from my love for my grandkids. So I was thrilled today that Gerber baby food company gave a big unconventional hug when it selected its 2018 Baby of the Year. They chose Lucas Warren, a 1-year-old with Down Syndrome. He's the first child with Down syndrome to be picked for the role of Gerber spokesbaby since the contest started in 2010. He was chosen from a pool of more than 140,000 entries. And a Gerber spokeswoman explained, "Gerber has a long-standing heritage of recognizing that every baby is a Gerber baby. And this year, Lucas is a perfect fit." Congratulations, Lucas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So cute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. Adorable.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Cute. Want me to go, K.G.?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Today David Beckham, you know him, K.G.?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So he launched a global malaria campaign. Malaria must die so millions can live. Calling upon leaders to prioritize the fight against malaria and build a strong mandate for bold political action. This is a disease that we could actually eliminate in our lifetime. The campaign launched with a film featuring Beckham in a glass box under attack by a swarm of mosquitoes, which is, like, one of my worst nightmares. But it does represent the overwhelming threat malaria poses. And you can find out more at malariamustdie.com. It can be done, you guys.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I totally support this. It's very deadly. It really affects children, too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We've made great progress.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's a good guy.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: All right. Tom is next. What have I doing? Besides the radio show, I've been doing theater. Back to my roots. Riverdale Children's Theater, the best children's theater in America. Look at Captain Hook, that's me as Captain Hook.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that you?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: A production of "Peter Pan," and I was in it with my kids. It's a great theater. We did almost 70 kids and me as Captain Hook. There's my daughters, Agnes and Louise. They were in the cast.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So cute.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: And there's -- I think we have a group photo of the whole cast.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Look at that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Tom, that's kind of a big deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, it is a big deal.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Huge theater.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He is very talented. He's very recession proof, because he can, you know, hang with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How many nights?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: We did it -- we did six performances, and it's a great theater if anyone is in New York. It's the Riverdale Children's Theater.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Impressive, I have to say.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, but you were the only adult in the show?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: We did have another adult playing, you know, Mrs. Darling. You play Captain Hook and Mr. Darling. The Darling family. So -- but it was a great huge, wonderful cast.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did you ever forget a line?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Found an onion.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: You know, I was a little bit loose with the lines sometimes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You improvise a little bit? Radio has done that for you.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Did you scratch your nose with the hook?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I've got to go. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next with Shannon Bream tonight.
